de.systemagmbh.tools.util
Class CSysObjectQueue

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.util.CSysObjectQueue
public final class CSysObjectQueue
extends Object

A FIFO Object queue.

$Revision: 1.4 $
Author:
Systema

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

CSysObjectQueue

public CSysObjectQueue()
Default Constructor.

Method Detail

flush

public void flush()
Flush the queue. This will delete the current contents of the queue by reinitializing it.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tests whether the queue is empty or not.

Returns:
true if the queue is empty, false otherwise.

isFull

public boolean isFull()
Test whether the queue exceeded maxSize or not.

Returns:
true if the queue exceeded maxSize.

getCount

public int getCount()
Get the current number of Objects in the queue.

Returns:
the current number of Objects in the queue.

resize

protected void resize(int size)
Resize the queue to a new size. User must ensure, that the new size is big enough to carry all elements that are in the queue.

Parameters:
size - the new queue size.

overFull

protected boolean overFull()
Test if the queues fill level is >= 75% of it's current max capacity.

Returns:
true if the fill level is >= 75 percent of queues max capacity.

underFull

protected boolean underFull()
Test if the queues fill level is < 25 percent of it's current max capacity and the queues max capacity is larger than minSize * 2.

Returns:
true if the fill level is < 25% and max capacity > minSize * 2

grow

protected void grow()
Force the queue to double it' capacity.

shrink

protected void shrink()
Force the queue to halve it's capacity.

adjust

protected void adjust()
Force the queue to adjust it's size, so it will be between underFull and overFull.

append

public void append(Object obj)
Append an Object to the queue. The size will be adjusted if necessary before appending the new object.

Parameters:
obj - the object to append.

extract

public Object extract()
Extract an Object from the queue.

Returns:
the eldest Object in the queue.

handle

public void handle(Object obj)
Handle an Object.

Parameters:
obj - the Object to handle.
See Also:
putObject(java.lang.Object)

putObject

public void putObject(Object obj)
Blocking operation to append an Object to the queue. If the queue is full, this operation will block until one place in the queue is freed by one of the getObject methods.

Parameters:
obj - the new Object
See Also:
putObject(java.lang.Object, long), getObject(), getObject(long)

putObject

public void putObject(Object obj,
                      long millis)
               throws CSysTimeoutException
Blocking operation to append an Object to the queue. If the queue is full, this operation will block until one place in the queue is freed by one of the getObject methods or the specified amount of time is expired.

Parameters:
obj - the new Object
millis - max time to wait in milliseconds
Throws:
CSysTimeoutException - if time to wait expires.
See Also:
putObject(java.lang.Object), getObject(), getObject(long)

getObject

public Object getObject()
Blocking operation to extract an Object from the queue. If the queue is empty, this operation will block until one Object is appended to the queue by one of the putObject methods.

Returns:
extracted Object
See Also:
putObject(java.lang.Object), putObject(java.lang.Object, long), getObject(long)

getObject

public Object getObject(long millis)
                 throws CSysTimeoutException
Blocking operation to extract an Object from the queue. If the queue is empty, this operation will block until one Object is appended to the queue by one of the putObject methods or the specified amount of time is expired.

Parameters:
millis - max time to wait in milliseconds
Returns:
extracted Object
Throws:
CSysTimeoutException - if time to wait expires.
See Also:
putObject(java.lang.Object), putObject(java.lang.Object, long), getObject(long)

toString

public String toString()
Create a String representation of the current queue.

Returns:
String representation of this ObjectQueue.
